## Code Chunks

Code chunks are useful when embeding sections of code directly in a markdown document. The code chunk allows for code to be syntactically highlighted to make it easier to read.

Check out all the [supported languages](https://docs.readme.com/rdmd/docs/code-blocks#language-support).

::: {.panel-tabset}

## Python

**Markup**:

    ```{{py}}
    print("Hello World")
    ```

**Output**:

```py
print("Hello World")
```

## JavaScript

**Markup**:

    ```{{js}}
    console.log("Hello World");
    ```

**Output**:

```js
console.log("Hello World");
```

:::

## Diagrams

In addition to code chunks, Markdown supports [Mermaid JS](https://mermaid.js.org/), which is a diagramming and charting tool. An example Mermaid diagram is illustrated below.

**Markup**

    ```{{mermaid}}
    flowchart LR
        Start --> Stop
    ```

**Output**

```{mermaid}
flowchart LR
    Start --> Stop
```
